intro: Marlierea montana, commonly known as the mountain marlierea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions.
